page.title: 19SCHOOL AND PLAY; GILLINGHAM
page.content:
Before the war there were four{schools in Gillingham; an infant school opposite the Post Office at Wyke, a grammar school and a secondary modern school. The latter two schools were combined to form the present comprehensive school in 1959.
The main{entertainment}in the 1940's was the cinema, followed by dances held in the dance hall in Station Road. Nowadays there are discos and the Youth Club, which was built on the site of the old Drill Hall. The Social Centre, next to the school, also provides{recreation. }The Coronation Club in Station Road used to be a Liberal Club before being turned into a Workingman's Club.
